message.content:
cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CL 

This paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it proposes a new layer in Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) to increase their robustness to several types of noise perturbations of the input images. Additionally, the paper also mentions the use of MNIST, CIFAR-10 and CIFAR-100 datasets which are commonly used in computer vision research. 

The paper also mentions a biologically-motivated non-linear model of certain neurons in the visual system, which suggests a possible connection to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category. 

The paper's focus on improving the performance of CNNs suggests a possible connection to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. 

Finally, the paper's use of convolutional layers and image classification tasks suggests a possible connection to the Natural Language Processing (cs.CL) sub-category, which also deals with image and text classification tasks.
